## Install Python

- Download from [python.org](https://www.python.org/downloads/)
- Check ‚ÄúAdd Python to PATH‚Äù during setup
- Verify:

  ```text
  python --version
  pip --version
  ```
- Optional: uninstall or remove older versions (e.g., Python 3.11)


## Install Quarto CLI

- Download from [quarto.org/get-started](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)
- Run installer (MSI for Windows)
- Verify installation:
  ```text
  quarto --version
  quarto check
  ```
- If needed, add Quarto `bin` folder to PATH

## Install Extra Python Packages

- In terminal, run:
  ```python
  pip install jupyter pyyaml
  ```
- Why install?
  - `jupyter`: enables running notebooks/code cells in Quarto
  - `pyyaml`: fixes YAML parsing error in Quarto checks
- Verify:
  ```text
  quarto check
  ```

## Create Your First Quarto Project

- In terminal, run:

  ```text
  quarto create-project "Data Dunkers Quarto Test" --type website
  cd "Data Dunkers Quarto Test"
  quarto preview
  ```

## Project files

- `_quarto.yml` ‚Üí site configuration
- `index.qmd` ‚Üí homepage
- `about.qmd` ‚Üí starter page

## Add a Slideshow

- Create folder `slides/`
- Add `intro.qmd` with front matter:
  ```yaml
  ---
  title: "Data Dunkers Demo Slides"
  format: revealjs
  ---
  ```
- Each `---` in file makes a new slide
- Link slideshow in `_quarto.yml` navbar

## Publish the Site
- Option A: **GitHub Pages**
  - Commit & push to GitHub
  - Add GitHub Action workflow for Quarto

- Option B: **Netlify**
